intro: Mesembryanthemum striatum var. pallens, commonly known as the pale-striated ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid conditions. The plant features fleshy, blue-green leaves with distinct white veins, and its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and striking appearance. The species is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil in sandy environments.
